entry.content: Few fandoms are as fervent as Astarion‚Äôs Months after Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3‚Äôs release, I continue to be haunted by one man. His face shows up on all of my feeds, he‚Äôs been the center of a few fan furors, and he feels like the natural evolution of some of my most beloved BioWare companions. I remain fascinated by Astarion, who has more than earned his place in the hall of fame of RPG allies, and I am not alone. entry.content: Image: Pocketpair What kind of stuff can you do in Palworld‚Äôs multiplayer? Palworld, the Pok√©mon-like survival crafting game, has a multiplayer component, but it can be finicky. There‚Äôs no PvP in the game, and while you can collaborate with your friends to build bigger bases and take down baddies, some of the progression remains solo. entry.content: Image: Zeekerss The comedic elements are the perfect match for how scary it is I didn‚Äôt really do horror games before Lethal Company. If I were to categorize myself, I‚Äôd fully check the ‚Äúscaredy cat‚Äù box. Jump scares make my heart race. Virtual creepy-crawlies twist my gut up inside. I enjoy a good sense of suspense in a game or movie, but I still struggle with it. (I do watch horror movies, but I break them into three sections to minimize the sense of dread.) Now, against all odds, I‚Äôve found ...

We will look at the fundamental concepts of quantum computing and the key terms that are used in the field. We will also cover the challenges that lie ahead for quantum computing and how they can be overcome.

AI systems capable of such diagnostic dialogues could increase availability, accessibility, quality and consistency of care by being useful conversational partners to clinicians and patients alike. But approximating clinicians‚Äô considerable expertise...

entry.title: Can large language models identify and correct their mistakes? | Google AI Blog
entry.summary: Posted by Gladys Tyen, Intern, Google Research LLMs are increasingly popular for reasoning tasks, such as multi-turn QA, task completion, code generation, or mathematics. Yet much like people, the...
entry.content: Posted by Gladys Tyen, Intern, Google Research LLMs are increasingly popular for reasoning tasks, such as multi-turn QA, task completion, code generation, or mathematics. Yet much like people, they do not always solve problems correctly on the first try, especially on tasks for which they were not trained. Therefore, for such systems to be most useful, they should be able to 1) identify where their reasoning went wrong and 2) backtrack to find another solution. This has led to a surge in ...

entry.content: A/B testing is a method of comparing two versions of a web page, app, or other product to see which one performs better. This article covers the basics of A/B testing, how to design and run an effective experiment, and how to analyze and interpret the results.

entry.content: Eric Siegel highlights the chronic under-deployment of ML projects, with only 22% of data scientists saying their revolutionary initiatives usually deploy, and a lack of stakeholder visibility and detailed planning as key issues, in his industry survey and book "The AI Playbook."
